pull.title: build: Bump VS minimum supported version to 18.0
pull.body: The new [VS 18.0](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes) release includes numerous bug fixes.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33861.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#33974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33974) (cmake: Check dependencies after build option interaction by hebasto)
* [#31974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31974) (Drop testnet3 by Sjors)
* [#31507](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31507) (build: Use clang-cl to build on Windows natively by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->
Seems a bit premature, if this is still waiting for multiple pieces of unreleased software? Could just wait for it to be shown as fixed in a nightly build?

events.body:
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -219,10 +219,10 @@ jobs:
         include:
           - job-type: standard
             generate-options: '-DBUILD_BENCH=ON -DBUILD_KERNEL_LIB=ON -DBUILD_UTIL_CHAINSTATE=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2026'
           - job-type: fuzz
             generate-options: '-DVCPKG_MANIFEST_NO_DEFAULT_FEATURES=ON -DVCPKG_MANIFEST_FEATURES="wallet" -DBUILD_GUI=OFF -DWITH_ZMQ=OFF -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2026'
comments.body: could remove the version/year here, as the docs and presets should already be clear on it? (no other ci task is having the version/year in the title)
